images.copyright: Bald eagle, Tongass National Forest, Alaska (© Jaynes Gallery/Shutterstock)
images.title: Celebrating an American icon
images.caption: American Eagle Day
images.desc: Bald eagles are a symbol of strength, determination, and courage. The powerful bird is celebrated every year on June 20, the day it was made the national symbol of the United States in 1782. President Bill Clinton commemorated this date by declaring it American Eagle Day in 1995. The bald eagle, named for its white-feathered head, was once an endangered bird, but conservation efforts and the Endangered Species Act have helped boost its numbers.
